those two links focus only on anarcho-capitalism. and "von mises institute" is in reality a liberal think tank and so not really specifically anarchist
/* Libertarian education */ Changed "Spanish" to "Catalan". doubt Francesc Ferrer would have wanted to be seen as "spanish"
/* Further reading */ factionalist resources creeping in again
rv. in late 19th century and early 20th century there was a trend in the anarchist movement that advocated individual terrorism in the classical sense of the word.
removed "terrorism" as a method used by anarchists, anarchists have never used terrorism, nor do have any ever advocated it.
No, I've heard of that too. It depends on how you define each one, but there are certainly people who consider themselves individualists that support common ownership of the means of production.
removed claim Proudhon is an individalist anarchist, pending dispute, because sources that say he is a social or communitarian anarchist. Removed oscar wild because no source on way or the other

Reverted to revision 370645044 by [[Special:Contributions/Zazaban|Zazaban]]; Terribly written opinion. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
Woodock says Prouhdon not an individualist anarchist
He was definitely both, and a prominent example.
see talk page. this sentence might need a change adding other individualist authors and tendencies advocatin socialism besides Proudhon
Woodcock, George. ''Anarchism: A History of Libertarian Ideas and Movements'', Broadview Press, 2004, p. 20 identifies Proudhon as a social anarchist.
proudhon was not the only individualist advocating socialism, illegalism in general was obviously anti-proterty or at least disrespectful of it in theory and practice
Not a scholarly consensus that Proudhon was an individualist anarchist
the article implies that socialist individualist anarhcists were a minority in individualist anarhcism, this is not true.
removed "terrorism" as a means some anarhcists wish to use to get to anarchy, no anarchists have ever advocated terrorism.
removed "authoritarian" state, anarhcists oppose states that are democratic as being extremely flawed aswell.

this article is not just about left or far left anarchists
Rv; that phrase was referring specifically to anarchists who support private property, not all anarchists; anarchist-communists mentioned earlier.
Changed incorrect phrase that anarchism "always" includes private property; changed to include situations in which anarchists act communally; cited anarcho-communist literature.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 340440836 by [[Special:Contributions/Darrennn|Darrennn]] ([[User talk:Darrennn|talk]]) While true, this is not improve the article.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 340012792 by [[Special:Contributions/68.226.208.131|68.226.208.131]] ([[User talk:68.226.208.131|talk]]) Spellign should be kept consistent per [[WP:ENGVAR]]
the source say egoism of Stirner. Try this. I'm just trying to distinguish this from run of the mill "egoism" like Ayn Rand. It's a special use of the term.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 339835494 by [[Special:Contributions/Jadabocho|Jadabocho]] ([[User talk:Jadabocho|talk]]) Forms of egoism exist in anarchism other than pure stirnerism.
just "egoism" is not communicative because this is a special use of the term "egoism"
/* Social anarchism */ Rephrase sentence on direct vs. consensus, as we no longer mention direct democracy in previous sentence.
/* Social anarchism */ Left in a stray word...
Partial revert; source doesn't say units would be self-sufficient, or mention consensus, but it does explicitly talk about democracy and federation
/* Social anarchism */ rewrite based on the source (in fact, the source didn't even mention "direct democracy").
/* Related pages */ might as well use the space provided
Creating new section. Turning "Issues" into a subsection. This looks a little haphazard and the intro is a bare sentence, but it's a start.
/* Related pages */ Cram'in those related portals in there.
/* Contemporary anarchism */ One last -ize needs fixing
/* Fight against fascism */ see also: [[Nationalism and anarchism]]
/* Organised labour */ remove image of dubious provenance for now; tried to clarify copyright status to no avail
/* Contemporary anarchism */ this paragraph feels to essayist to me; if it can be rebuild based on reliable sources then please feel free to restore it
/* Contemporary anarchism */ rework, expand, and reference paragraph on fin de siecle anarchism
/* Contemporary anarchism */ copyedit, add refs, add image
/* Libertarian education */ avoid linking within quotations
/* The First International */ +ref for Bakunin and co leaving the LPF for the International
/* Contemporary anarchism */ avoid potentially dated statements

/* Individualist anarchism */ if we can't really tell the reader anything about it, it's not worth mentioning; the "Verein der Egoisten" was never a fully-formed conception for Stirner, more of the beginnings of an idea
/* Free love */ Moving European material downa s it tends to be later

then take out the unnecessary "legal and economic". The Brooks source here clearly refers to egoism.
It's talking about economic and legal individualism.
/* Post-classical currents */ Rewording to explain Eclecticism and Syncretism.
/* Fight against fascism */ Rewording sentence to remove "victories", which carries certain unnecessary connotations.
/* Russian Revolution */ change explanation of Whites
/* Free love */ if these are the sexiest anarchist pin-ups they could find, no wonder the free love jazz never caught on
/* Organized labor */ ref for peak CNT membership
/* Russian Revolution */ Goldman, Berkman, and Revolution à la Bakunin
/* Russian Revolution */ +ref for anarchists joining Comintern
/* Organized labor */ rework Malatesta/Monatte debate with ref
/* Anarchist schools of thought */ further condense
/* Anarchist schools of thought */ redistribute images
further condense schools of thought, per talk
